	<title>Kontainers - Shipping Made Simple</title>
	<link>https://kontainers.com</link>
	<description>Kontainers removes the hassle of multiple phone calls, faxes for shipping and updating of your containers. By providing rates and schedules up front with no hidden costs we are the most transparent in the industry and aim to give our customers the most options possible.</description>

		<title>wooden-box</title>
		<link>https://kontainers.com/the-future-of-sea-freight-shipping/wooden-box/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 27 Oct 2015 08:05:55 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[pete@kontainers.co.uk]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://kontainers.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/10/wooden-box.jpg</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>sea freight vs air freight</title>
		<link>https://kontainers.com/sea-freight-vs-air-freight/ocean-freight-vs-air-freight-2/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 13 Nov 2015 13:03:24 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[pete@kontainers.co.uk]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://kontainers.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/11/ocean-freight-vs-air-freight1.jpg</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Whether you are moving abroad or sending products to clients, there are two ways to ship items vast distances: air or sea.]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>476</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2015-11-13 13:03:24]]></wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2015-11-13 13:03:24]]></wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[open]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name><![CDATA[ocean-freight-vs-air-freight-2]]></wp:post_name>
		<wp:status><![CDATA[inherit]]></wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>397</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[attachment]]></wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password><![CDATA[]]></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
		<wp:attachment_url><![CDATA[https://kontainers.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/11/ocean-freight-vs-air-freight1.jpg]]></wp:attachment_url>
		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_wp_attached_file]]></wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[2015/11/ocean-freight-vs-air-freight1.jpg]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_wp_attachment_metadata]]></wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[a:5:{s:5:"width";i:1024;s:6:"height";i:636;s:4:"file";s:41:"2015/11/ocean-freight-vs-air-freight1.jpg";s:5:"sizes";a:3:{s:9:"thumbnail";a:4:{s:4:"file";s:41:"ocean-freight-vs-air-freight1-150x150.jpg";s:5:"width";i:150;s:6:"height";i:150;s:9:"mime-type";s:10:"image/jpeg";}s:6:"medium";a:4:{s:4:"file";s:41:"ocean-freight-vs-air-freight1-300x186.jpg";s:5:"width";i:300;s:6:"height";i:186;s:9:"mime-type";s:10:"image/jpeg";}s:5:"large";a:4:{s:4:"file";s:42:"ocean-freight-vs-air-freight1-1024x636.jpg";s:5:"width";i:1024;s:6:"height";i:636;s:9:"mime-type";s:10:"image/jpeg";}}s:10:"image_meta";a:11:{s:8:"aperture";i:0;s:6:"credit";s:0:"";s:6:"camera";s:0:"";s:7:"caption";s:0:"";s:17:"created_timestamp";i:0;s:9:"copyright";s:0:"";s:12:"focal_length";i:0;s:3:"iso";i:0;s:13:"shutter_speed";i:0;s:5:"title";s:0:"";s:11:"orientation";i:0;}}]]></wp:meta_value>

	<item>
		<title>Drug smuggling and sea freight</title>
		<link>https://kontainers.com/drugs-and-hackers/drug-smuggling/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 17 Nov 2015 12:40:20 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[pete@kontainers.co.uk]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://kontainers.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/11/Drug-Smuggling.jpg</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>482</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2015-11-17 12:40:20]]></wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2015-11-17 12:40:20]]></wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[open]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name><![CDATA[drug-smuggling]]></wp:post_name>
		<wp:status><![CDATA[inherit]]></wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>477</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[attachment]]></wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password><![CDATA[]]></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
		<wp:attachment_url><![CDATA[https://kontainers.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/11/Drug-Smuggling.jpg]]></wp:attachment_url>
		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_wp_attached_file]]></wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[2015/11/Drug-Smuggling.jpg]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_wp_attachment_metadata]]></wp:meta_key>

	<item>
		<title>The globe of economic complexity</title>
		<link>https://kontainers.com/what-are-the-most-popular-exports/the-globe-of-economic-complexity/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 24 Nov 2015 14:02:10 +0000</pubDate>

	<item>
		<title>kiwi-fruit</title>

	<item>
		<title>Shipping-Before-Containers</title>
		<link>https://kontainers.com/shipping-before-containers/shipping-before-containers/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 08 Dec 2015 13:42:56 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[pete@kontainers.co.uk]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://kontainers.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/12/Shipping-Before-Containers.jpg</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>632</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2015-12-08 13:42:56]]></wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2015-12-08 13:42:56]]></wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[open]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name><![CDATA[shipping-before-containers]]></wp:post_name>
		<wp:status><![CDATA[inherit]]></wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>631</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[attachment]]></wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password><![CDATA[]]></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
		<wp:attachment_url><![CDATA[https://kontainers.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/12/Shipping-Before-Containers.jpg]]></wp:attachment_url>
		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_wp_attached_file]]></wp:meta_key>

	<item>
		<title>3-environment-waste</title>
		<link>https://kontainers.com/what-happens-to-the-worlds-garbage/3-environment-waste/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 26 Jan 2016 14:37:53 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[pete@kontainers.co.uk]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://kontainers.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/01/3-environment-waste.jpg</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>IMB-Piracy-Armed-Robbery-Map-2014</title>

	<item>
		<title>shipping-assessment-cta</title>
		<link>https://kontainers.com/shipping-assessment-cta-2/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 19 Feb 2016 13:25:05 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[pete@kontainers.co.uk]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://kontainers.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/02/shipping-assessment-cta.jpg</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>949</wp:post_id>

	<item>

			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
	</item>
	<item>
		<title>How it Works</title>
		<link>https://kontainers.com/how-it-works/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 09 Oct 2015 10:40:25 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[captain]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://home.kontainers.co.uk/?page_id=16</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<div class="how-it-works">

<div class="form_holder">

<div class="content_holder">

<div class="row ">

<div class="twelve columns">

<h1>How it works</h1>

<div class="page-holder ">

<p class="k-p how-it-works-intro">Kontainers removes the hassle of multiple phone calls, faxes for shipping and updating of your containers. By providing rates and schedules up front with no hidden costs we are the most transparent in the industry and aim to give our customers the most options possible.</p>

<div class="row">

<div class="eight columns">

<div class="home-image">

<div class="anotation home-image-a">

<p>Port of Load</p>

</div>

<div class="anotation home-image-b">

<p>Port of Destination</p>

</div>

</div>

</div>

<div class="four columns">

<h2>STEP 1</h2>

<p>Search from our home page by choosing the town of collection and the port of destination.</p>

</div>

</div>

</div>

</div>

</div>

</div>

<div class="cloud-1"></div>

<div class="dashboard-steps second-step">

<div class="content_holder ">

<div class="row">

<div class="four columns">

<h2>STEP 2</h2>

<p>Specify the number of containers you want to ship for this trip. You can also select if the container is refrigerated.</p>

</div>

<div class="eight columns">

<div class="selector-image">

<div class="anotation selector-image-a">

Container selectors

</div>

</div>

</div>

</div>

</div>

</div>

<div class="dashboard-steps darker-row">

<div class="content_holder ">

<div class="row darker-row">

<div class="eight columns">

<div class="quotes-image">

<div class="anotation quotes-image-a">

<p>Sort Quotes</p>

</div>

<div class="anotation quotes-image-b">

<p>Select a Quote</p>

</div>

</div>

</div>

<div class="four columns">

<h2>STEP 3</h2>

<p>Choose the sailing that suites your requirements best. Whether it's departure date, transit time or price./p>

</div>

</div>

</div>

</div>

<div class="dashboard-steps ">

<div class="content_holder ">

<div class="row">

<div class="four columns">

<h2>STEP 4</h2>

<p>Fill in the order. If you fill in your trucking and customs requirments we can also handle that for you.</p>

</div>

<div class="eight columns">

<div class="order-image">

<div class="anotation order-image-a">

<p>Trucking</p>

</div>

<div class="anotation order-image-b">

<p>Customs</p>

</div>

</div>

</div>

</div>

</div>

</div>

<div class="dashboard-steps darkest-row">

<div class="content_holder ">

<div class="row">

<div class="eight columns">

          <div class="confirm-image"></div>

        </div>

<div class="four columns">

<h2>STEP 5</h2>

<p>Review your order and confirm the cost. You can edit at any time up to sailing.</p>

</div>

</div>

</div>

</div>

<div class="dashboard-steps ">

<div class="content_holder ">

<div class="row">

<div class="five columns">

<h2>STEP 6</h2>

<p>You can now either pay online so we can confirm your booking straight away or use bank transfer and we will confirm your order once we have received payment.</p>

</div>

<div class="seven columns">

          <div class="payment-image"></div>

        </div>

</div>

</div>

</div>

<div class="dashboard-steps darker-row dash-image">

<div class="content_holder ">

<div class="row">

<div class="twelve columns">

<h2>STEP 7</h2>

<p>From here your shipment is done. Sit back and watch real-time updates on your dashboard. Once on board it will also include bill of lading preview and once you approve it will be issued.</p>

</div>

</div>

</div>

</div>

<div class="dashboard-steps ">

<div class="content_holder ">

<div class="row">

<div class="five columns">

          <div class="copy-image"></div>

        </div>

<div class="seven columns">

<h2>STEP 8</h2>

<p>For your next order just copy the last order so it only takes seconds!/p>

</div>

</div>

</div>

</div>

<div class="cta">

<div class="content_holder ">

<div class="row">

<div class="seven columns">

<h2>GET STARTED</h2>

<p>See how it easy it is? Want to try us for your next order? Get started by clicking on <strong>'Get Quote'</strong> now or email us at <a title="Email Support" href="mailto:help@kontainers.co.uk">help@kontainers.co.uk</a> for more information.</p>

</div>

<div class="five columns"><a class="bc_button action_goToApp" tabindex="4">Get Instant Quotes</a></div>

</div>

</div>

</div>

       <div class="footer">

      <a> Kontainers &copy; 2016 Cracking Logistics Limited. All rights reserved </a> 

    </div>

</div>

</div>]]></content:encoded>

		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:ping_status>

		</wp:postmeta>

			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[default]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
	</item>
	<item>
		<title>The Team</title>
		<link>https://kontainers.com/the-team/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 09 Oct 2015 10:40:40 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[captain]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://home.kontainers.co.uk/?page_id=18</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<div class="form_holder who-we-are">

    <div class="content_holder">

      <div class="row ">

        <div class="twelve columns">

          <h1>The Team</h1>

          <div class="page-holder">

            <div class="our-values">

              <div class="logo-icon"></div>

              <p>We take pride in being one of the most advanced and fastest growing companies within the shipping world. We are passionate about pushing the industry forward leaps and bounds and are committed to being an innovative and disruptive force within the industry.</p>

            </div>

          </div>

        </div>

        <ul class="team-members-list">

          <li> <a title="Linked In profile" target="_blank" href="https://uk.linkedin.com/pub/graham-parker/a1/560/24" class="btn-linkedIn"></a><span>Graham Parker<i>CEO</i></span> <img src="https://kontainers.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/10/graham.jpg" /></li><li> <a title="Linked In profile" target="_blank" href="https://uk.linkedin.com/in/charlielee/" class="btn-linkedIn"></a><span>Charles Lee<i>CTO</i></span> <img src="https://kontainers.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/10/charlie.jpg" /></li><li> <a title="Linked In profile" target="_blank" href="https://ie.linkedin.com/pub/brendan-mcdonagh/1/b41/a14" class="btn-linkedIn"></a><span>Brendan McDonagh<i>Chairman</i></span> <img src="https://kontainers.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/10/brendan.jpg" /></li><li> <a title="Linked In profile" target="_blank" href="http://dk.linkedin.com/in/larsjensenseaintel" class="btn-linkedIn"></a><span>Lars Jensen<i>Advisor</i></span> <img src="https://kontainers.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/10/lars.jpg" /></li><li> <a title="Linked In profile" target="_blank" href="https://www.linkedin.com/pub/marlyse-mahoudeau/81/97b/70a" class="btn-linkedIn"></a><span>Marlyse Mahoudeau<i>Account Manager</i></span> <img src="https://kontainers.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/10/marlyse.jpg" /></li><li> <a title="Linked In profile" target="_blank" href="https://www.linkedin.com/home?trk=nav_responsive_tab_home"  class="btn-linkedIn"></a><span>Helen Moralee<i> Operations & Customer Services</i></span> <img src="https://kontainers.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/10/helen.jpg" /></li>

          <li> <a title="Linked In profile" target="_blank" href="https://uk.linkedin.com/in/pwaldock" class="btn-linkedIn"></a><span>Peter Waldock<i>Head of Design</i></span> <img src="https://kontainers.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/10/pete-waldock.jpg" /></li>

          <li> <a title="Linked In profile" target="_blank" href="https://ie.linkedin.com/pub/houzhang-liang/67/b47/698" class="btn-linkedIn"></a><span>Houzhang Liang<i>Product Architect</i></span> <img src="https://kontainers.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/10/houzhang.jpg" /></li>

          <li> <a title="Linked In profile" target="_blank" href="https://uk.linkedin.com/in/petagrewal" class="btn-linkedIn"></a><span>Peta Grewal<i>Digital Marketing Manager</i></span> <img src="https://kontainers.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/10/peta.jpg" /></li>

          <li class="join-team">

            <div>

              <h2>Join the Team</h2>

              <a href="https://kontainers.com/contact-us/">We're always on the lookout for passionate and talented people. If you'd like to help us shape the future of freight shipping we'd really love to hear from you.</a></div>

          </li>

        </ul>

        <h2>Our Investors</h2>

        <div class="investors"> <a title="EC1 Capital" class="bc-link ec1" href="http://www.ec1capital.com/" target="_blank"><span>EC1 Capital</span></a> <a title="Partech Ventures" class="bc-link partech" href="http://www.partechventures.com/" target="_blank"><span>Partech Ventures</span></a> <a title="Northstar Ventures" class="bc-link ignite" href="http://www.northstarventures.co.uk/" target="_blank"><span>Northstar Ventures</span></a> <a title="Ignite" class="bc-link ignite" href="http://ignite100.com/main/" target="_blank"><span>Ignite</span></a> </div>

        <h2>Our Associates &amp; Partners</h2>

        <div class="associates"> <a title="china britain business council" class="bc-link cbbc" href="http://www.cbbc.org/" target="_blank"><span>China Britain Business Council</span></a> <a title="Food & Drink Exporters Association" class="bc-link fdea" href="http://www.ukfdea.com/" target="_blank"><span>Food & Drink Exporters Association</span></a> <a title="NOF energy" class="bc-link nof" href="http://www.nofenergy.co.uk/" target="_blank"><span>NOF energy</span></a> <a title="SSA" class="bc-link ssa" href="http://www.ssa.org.uk/" target="_blank"><span>SSA</span></a> </div>

        

        <!-- /contact_info --> 

        

      </div>

    </div>

       <div class="footer">

	</item>
	<item>
		<title>FAQ</title>
		<link>https://kontainers.com/faq/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 09 Oct 2015 10:41:05 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[captain]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://home.kontainers.co.uk/?page_id=22</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<div class="form_holder">

  <div class="content_holder">

    <div class="row ">

      <div class="twelve columns">

        <h1>Frequently Asked Questions</h1>

        <div class="page-holder">

          <div class="FAQ">

            <h2>1. What is Kontainers?</h2>

            <p>Kontainers is a company created based on need. The process of ocean freight forwarding is burdened with inefficiency, lack of upfront options and hidden charges.</p>

              <p>We aim to solve this problem by leveraging technology and good honest customer service.Our platform instantly gives you rates for over 250 of the largest ports for UK exporters (and growing). It also gives you the ability to book and transact your shipment online in seconds from your door, including customs, where real-time updates drastically cut time spent looking at shipping and increase productivity and service to your client. </p>

            

            <h2>2. Who we are and what is our strategy?</h2>

            <p>At Kontainers, we have over 50 years of experience ranging from freight forwarding, technology, customer service and business development. We retain customers by providing the largest amount of options possible, being totally transparent in our pricing and the best customer service experience this industry has ever seen.</p>

            <h2>3. What if my destination is missing?</h2>

            <p>No problem, we are adding more daily but mail us on <a href="mailto:help@kontainers.co.uk">help@kontainers.co.uk</a> and we will prioritise them for you.</p>

           

            <h2>4. How secure is Kontainers?</h2>

            <p>Our site uses world class 128bit encryption technologies used by online banks. Your payment details never reach our servers, they go directly to <a href="https://stripe.com" target="_blank">stripe</a> a specialised payment gateway (similar to paypal).</p>

            <h2>5. Is it really that simple to book a container in under one minute?</h2>

            <p>Yes, but not only that, after your work is done sit back and watch the shipment update in real-time.</p>

            <h2>6. What if I need help? Or have questions about what we do?</h2>

            <p>Call us from 6am to 8pm GMT, drop us an email or use the instant chat feature on the bottom right of your screen.</p>

          </div>

        </div>

      </div>

    </div>



    <!-- /contact_info -->



  

</div>



   <div class="footer">

      <div class="partner-logos"> 

      <a> Kontainers &copy; 2016 Cracking Logistics Limited. All rights reserved </a> 

    </div>



</div>]]></content:encoded>

	</item>
	<item>
		<title>Media Kit</title>
		<link>https://kontainers.com/media-kit/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 09 Oct 2015 10:41:26 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[captain]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://home.kontainers.co.uk/?page_id=24</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<div class="media-kit">

  <div class="form_holder">

  <div class="content_holder">

    <div class="row ">

      <div class="twelve columns">

        <h1>Our Brand</h1>

        <div class="page-holder">

          <div class="our-values">

            <p>The Kontainers brand is more than a logo. It is a set of values, beliefs, and artwork that reflects the spirit of our company. Using it consistently will reinforce our passion and commitment to providing a world class experience.</p>

            <p style="float:right;"><a class="bc_button moveForward" target="_blank" href="https://drive.google.com/a/kontainers.co.uk/file/d/0B6H5slcgQGNvM1REU1BPSWtrdGM/view?usp=sharing">Brand Guidelines</a></p> </div>

          <div class="row asset-row">

            <div class="six columns">

              <h2>Logotype &amp; Device</h2>

              <p>The Kontainers logotype and logo device have evolved just as Kontainers is evolving.

                Their simplicity denotes quality and transparency, and they have been designed to stand alone.</p>

              <p>Adequate space must allowed around each as specified. Minimum size is at your descretion although letter forms should be clearly legible.</p>

              <p>Download the assets below and treat in accordance with the <a target="_blank" href=" https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B6H5slcgQGNvM1REU1BPSWtrdGM/view?usp=sharing">brand guidlines</a>.</p>

            </div>

            <div class="six columns"> <img src="https://kontainers.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/10/logo-spec.jpg" width="384" height="264" alt=""/> </div>

          </div>

          <div class="row asset-row">

            <div class="four columns">

              <h2>Logotype v1</h2>

              <p>The logotype is the prefered brand identifier unless there is insufficient space. In such circumstances the logo device should be used.</p>

            </div>

            <div class="eight columns">

              <div class="asset-holder"> <img src="https://kontainers.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/10/logo-kontainers-dark-text.png" width="400" height="94" alt=""/>

                                                

                <div class="asset-tools">

                  <p>Download Files</p>

                  <a class="btn-download-png" target="_blank" href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B6H5slcgQGNvMmJwdFgycDJLeWc/view?usp=sharing" ></a> <a class="btn-download-eps" target="_blank" href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B6H5slcgQGNvYXBNaXAyQklWdDQ/view?usp=sharing"></a> </div>

              </div>

            </div>

          </div>

          <div class="row asset-row">

            <div class="four columns">

              <h2>Logotype v2</h2>

              <p>The logotype also comes in white but only should be used mounted on the brand background colours Kontainers Blue or Kontainers Black.</p>

            </div>

            <div class="eight columns">

              <div class="asset-holder brand-dark-bg"> <img src="https://kontainers.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/10/logo-kontainers-white-text.png" width="400" height="94" alt=""/>

                <div class="asset-tools">

                  <p>Download Files</p>

                  <a class="btn-download-png" target="_blank" href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B6H5slcgQGNvQ2E5TXUtWGs4TUE/view?usp=sharing"></a> 

                  <a class="btn-download-eps" target="_blank" href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B6H5slcgQGNvcGdna2dTRTk5MFE/view?usp=sharing"></a> </div>

              </div>

            </div>

          </div>

          <div class="row asset-row">

            <div class="four columns">

              <h2>Logotype v3</h2>

              <p>This version should be used if the contexts background is not Kontainers Blue or Kontainers Black.</p>

            </div>

            <div class="eight columns">

              <div class="asset-holder"> <img src="https://kontainers.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/10/logo-kontainers.png" width="400" height="128" alt=""/>

                <div class="asset-tools">

                  <p>Download Files</p>

                  <a class="btn-download-png" target="_blank" href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B6H5slcgQGNvV1FQY3RmX2MyYW8/view?usp=sharing"></a> 

                  <a class="btn-download-eps" target="_blank" href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B6H5slcgQGNvVk5NTjJ3S283aE0/view?usp=sharing"></a> </div>

              </div>

            </div>

          </div>

          <div class="row asset-row">

            <div class="four columns">

              <h2>Logo Device v1</h2>

              <p>The logo device should be used when space is at a premium or where the text "Kontainers" features alongside the logo (e.g. Social media posts).</p>

              <p>It can only be used individually, not in in conjunction with the logo type.</p>

            </div>

            <div class="eight columns">

              <div class="asset-holder"> <img src="https://kontainers.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/10/logo-device-kontainers.png" width="220" height="219" alt=""/>

                <div class="asset-tools">

                  <p>Download Files</p>

                  <a class="btn-download-png" target="_blank" href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B6H5slcgQGNvRzl6N2s0OGw4SVU/view?usp=sharing"></a> 

                  <a class="btn-download-eps" target="_blank" href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B6H5slcgQGNvbWpmemZ2TjN5VVU/view?usp=sharing"></a> </div>

              </div>

            </div>

          </div>

          <div class="row asset-row">

            <div class="four columns">

              <h2>Logo Device v2</h2>

              <p>For situations where only one colour can be used or the use of the Kontainer gradient does not work in the design context.</p>

              <p>The only allowable background colour is white.</p>

            </div>

            <div class="eight columns">

              <div class="asset-holder"> <img src="https://kontainers.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/10/logo-device-mono-blue-kontainers.png" width="220" height="219" alt=""/>

                <div class="asset-tools">

                  <p>Download Files</p>

                  <a class="btn-download-png" target="_blank" href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B6H5slcgQGNvN2lGRDMzUUh0SUE/view?usp=sharing"></a> 

                  <a class="btn-download-eps" target="_blank" href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B6H5slcgQGNvWFdfY3JpQ2pnSkE/view?usp=sharing"></a> </div>

              </div>

            </div>

          </div>

          <div class="row asset-row">

            <div class="four columns">

              <h2>Logo Device v3</h2>

              <p>For situations where only one colour can be used or the use of the Kontainer gradient does not work in the design context.</p>

              <p>The only allowable background colours are Kontainers Blue and Kontainers Black.</p>

            </div>

            <div class="eight columns">

              <div class="asset-holder brand-dark-bg"> <img src="https://kontainers.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/10/logo-device-mono-white-kontainers.png" width="220" height="219" alt=""/>

                <div class="asset-tools">

                  <p>Download Files</p>

                  <a class="btn-download-png" target="_blank" href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B6H5slcgQGNvWFdTY0dkbWdKWUE/view?usp=sharing"></a> 

                  <a class="btn-download-eps" target="_blank" href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B6H5slcgQGNvLXZSS0pHSWpTMGM/view?usp=sharing"></a> </div>

              </div>

            </div>

          </div>

          <div class="row asset-row">

            <div class="twelve columns">

              <h2>Primary Colour Palette</h2>

              <p>Our core brand colours strive to support our key brand positioning pilllars of innovation, transaprency and simplicity, and aim at building and fostering trust in the company and its products. The sceondary colour palette and other brand colours can be found in the <a target="_blank" href=" https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B6H5slcgQGNvM1REU1BPSWtrdGM/view?usp=sharing">Brand Guidelines</a>.</p>

              <div class="three columns">

                <div class="brand-colour kontainers-black">

                  <h3>Kontainers Black</h3>

                  <span class="colour-hex">#111111</span> <span class="colour-cmyk"><strong>C</strong>:73 <strong>M</strong>:67 <strong>Y</strong>:67 K:83</span> </div>

              </div>

              <div class="three columns">

                <div class="brand-colour kontainers-blue">

                  <h3>Kontainers Blue</h3>

                  <span class="colour-hex">#1D2C59</span> <span class="colour-cmyk"><strong>C</strong>:100 <strong>M</strong>:91 <strong>Y</strong>:36 K:30</span> </div>

              </div>

              <div class="three columns">

                <div class="brand-colour kontainers-turquoise">

                  <h3>Kontainers Turquoise</h3>

                  <span class="colour-hex">#2BA6B3</span> <span class="colour-cmyk"><strong>C</strong>:74 <strong>M</strong>:14 <strong>Y</strong>:29 K:0</span> </div>

              </div>

              <div class="three columns">

                <div class="brand-colour kontainers-yellow">

                  <h3>Kontainers Yellow</h3>

                  <span class="colour-hex">#F1BF1A</span> <span class="colour-cmyk"><strong>C</strong>:5 <strong>M</strong>:24 <strong>Y</strong>:100 K:0</span> </div>

              </div>

            </div>

          </div>

          <div class="row asset-row">

            <div class="twelve columns">

              <h2>Photography</h2>

              <p>Most Kontainers photography should feature environments shown at large scale reflecting the collosal nature of the industry. This central theme of size and scale underpins every aspect (network, vessels, volume) which is re-inforced through our brand imagery. The juxtaposition of vast and complex symbolism with our straightforward user experience supports our key tenet of making the complex elementary, Shippinng made Simple. Tones of blue are also important to link with identitly colours.</p>

              <p>Approved photograhy examples can be downloaded form the Kontainers <a target="_blank" href="https://drive.google.com/folderview?id=0B6H5slcgQGNvMTVYQUEyVk5DWjA&usp=sharing">Photography Library</a>.</p>

            </div>

          </div>

        </div>

      </div>

	<item>
		<title>Terms &amp; Conditions</title>
		<link>https://kontainers.com/terms-conditions/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 09 Oct 2015 10:41:40 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[captain]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://home.kontainers.co.uk/?page_id=26</guid>

		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<div class="form_holder">



  <div class="content_holder">

    <div class="row ">

      <div class="twelve columns">



        <h1>Terms &amp; Conditions</h1>

        <div class="page-holder">



            <p>

                <strong>IMPORTANT NOTICE</strong>

            </p>

            <p>

                When booking one or several shipments with KONTAINERS, you as a customer, are agreeing on your behalf and on behalf of anyone else with an

                interest in the shipment that the Terms and Conditions shall apply from the time you sign in.

            </p>

            <p>

                Booking means any completed order(s) made through KONTAINERS website

            </p>

            <p>

                Shipment or consignment means Cargo transported under the terms of a single Bill of Lading, irrespective of the quantity or number of containers.

            </p>

            <h2>1. Services provided</h2>

            <p>

                KONTAINERS provides ocean freight quotations for FCL (full container load) shipment from a range of shipping lines for free.

            </p>

            <p>

                KONTAINERS offers a dynamic online-based booking tool that allows a customer to book their shipments via an easy to use web interface.

            </p>





            <h2>2. Unacceptable bookings</h2>

            <p>

                Customer agrees that its shipment(s) is acceptable for transportation and is deemed unacceptable if:

            </p>

            <ul>

                <li>Goods are prohibited or restricted by any International conventions or any applicable government department or other relevant organization,</li>

                <li>no customs declaration is made when required by applicable customs regulations,</li>

                <li>it contains counterfeit goods, animals, bullion, currency, banderols/tax stickers, bearer form negotiable instruments, precious metals and stones; real or

                    imitation firearms, parts thereof, weapons, explosives and ammunition; human remains, pornography or illegal narcotics/drugs).</li>

            </ul>



            <h2>3. Booking information</h2>

            <p>

                Customers are bound to enter the correct information. KONTAINERS canare not held liable for any incorrect, wrong or missing information.

            </p>

            <p>

                KONTAINERS do not act on behalf of customers when booking a shipment. Consequently, customers are fully responsible for the information provided on the

                booking.

            </p>



            <h2>4. Carriage:</h2>

            <p>

                KONTAINERS is not an actual Carrier as defined by the Hamburg rules (United Nations on the carriage of goods by sea, 1978).

            </p>

            <p>

                Since the contract of carriage is concluded with the shipping line via KONTAINERS platform, the shipping lines remain the actual carrier of the

                goods.

            </p>

            <p>

                Customers when selecting a rate for booking purposes, entrust the chosen shipping line with the performance of the carriage of the goods.

            </p>



            <h2>5. Customs formalities</h2>

            <p>

                When requested, the export customs clearance will be performed by KONTAINERS.

            </p>

            <p>

                KONTAINERS will use the information provided in the booking to fill in the customs declaration.

            </p>

            <p>

                Customers will be liable if an incorrect commodity code or invoice value has been provided.

            </p>





            <h2>6. Insurance</h2>

            <p>

                According to the International conventions relative to the international goods transportation, shippers should insure their goods.

            </p>



            <h2>7. Loss and Damages</h2>

            <p>

                KONTAINERS canare not held liable for any loss or damages

            </p>



            <h2>8. Booking modification</h2>

            <p>

                KONTAINERS canare not held responsible for any cancellation made by the shipping lines.

            </p>

            <p>

                In case of pick up or vessel cancellation, KONTAINERS must inform its customers within a reasonable time.

            </p>

            <p>

                KONTAINERS can suggest available alternatives, but the acceptance of an alternative routing remains the customers own decision.

            </p>



            <h2>9. Rates</h2>

            <p>

                9.1. on the top of the ocean freight and trucking fees will be added for each booking:

            </p>

            <p>

                Handling fee: 120 per container

            </p>

            <p>

                B/L fee: 50 per booking

            </p>

            <p>

                Customs fee (if you choose the option): 20 per booking

            </p>

            <p>

                9.2. Our Rates DO NOT include the following items:

            </p>



            <ul>

                <li>Shipping to or from residential locations</li>

                <li>Personal effects, household goods, automobiles, motorcycles, ATV's</li>

                <li>Scrap material of any kind (includes: scrap metal and plastic scrap)</li>

                <li>Frozen or refrigerated perishable goods that require a temperature-controlled environment</li>

                <li>Antiques, works of art or fine art</li>

                <li>Jewellery, precious gems or stones or precious metals with a value greater than $50,000</li>

                <li>Bullion, cash or cash like negotiable instruments in bearer form</li>

                <li>Firearms, firearm parts or ammunition</li>

                <li>Dangerous, hazardous or flammable goods</li>

                <li>Furs and ivory</li>

                <li>Human remains of ashes, bodily fluid or tissue samples</li>

                <li>Goods considered illegal at any point its transit</li>

                <li>Insects, larvae, pupae etc or live animals</li>

                <li>Tobacco, loose leaf tobacco product or pre-rolled cigarettes</li>

                <li>Liquor or beer</li>

                <li>Drug, narcotics or pharmaceutical products</li>

                <li>Unpackaged agricultural goods including, but not limited to grain, feed or seeds</li>

                <li>Timber products and non-treated wood</li>

            </ul>





            <h2>10. Payment terms</h2>

            <p>

                Invoices are to be paid within 7 days from the date of issue of the invoice.

            </p>

            <h2>11. Website</h2>

            <p>

                11.1. The contents, commercial activities, products and services contained on the Website are not intended or directed at persons residing in jurisdictions

                where their contents are not properly authorised.

            </p>

            <p>

                11.2. The website comprises only those pages served by <a href="http://kontainers.co.uk" target="_blank">www.kontainers.co.uk</a> at all times.

                Accessing and browsing the Website is the sole responsibility of the users in the terms provided in the General Conditions.

            </p>

            <p>

                11.3. The consultation of any of the contents of the Website does not in itself constitute any contractual relationship between the user and Kontainers.

            </p>

            <h2>12. Obligations</h2>

            <p>

                12.1. The user agrees to use the services and contents of the Website in accordance with the Law, these General Conditions and the specific conditions of

                the services offered by Kontainers at all times, and must refrain from using them for:

            </p>

            <ul>

                <li> Contents, contrary to good faith, morality, public order, or practice, and / or illicit criminal activities or activities in breach of the regulations on

                    intellectual property, or any other applicable legal standard.

                </li>

                <li>

                    Spread contents of racist, xenophobic, an apology of terrorism and / or that violates human rights.

                </li>

                <li>

                    Introduce or spread data programs (viruses and harmful software) susceptible to cause damage to computer systems Kontainers, its suppliers or third Users

                    of the internal network or network of this website.

                </li>

                <li>

                    Transmit to unauthorised parties your username and password, assuming full responsibility for the consequences disclosure and must immediately inform

                    Kontainers access by an unauthorised user to this information. To this end, Kontainers reserves the right to change the username and password for the

                    service protection.

                </li>

                <li>

                    Make available to other users, email or otherwise transmit any content that, in accordance with the applicable provisions or contractual relationship, the

                    user is not authorised to transmit (such as inside information, information protected by copyright industrial or intellectual property or information which

                    have a duty of confidentiality).

                </li>

                <li>

                    Make available to other users, email or otherwise transmit any content that, in accordance with the applicable provisions or contractual relationship, the

                    user is not authorised to transmit (such as inside information, information protected by copyright industrial or intellectual property or information which

                    have a duty of confidentiality).

                </li>

                <li>

                    Make available to other users, email or otherwise transmit any content that, in accordance with the applicable provisions or contractual relationship, the

                    user is not authorised to transmit (such as inside information, information protected by copyright industrial or intellectual property or information which

                    have a duty of confidentiality).

                </li>

                <li>

                    Contents spamming practices and generally disseminate unsolicited or unauthorised advertising, promotional materials, "junk mail," "chain letters,"

                    "pyramid schemes" or any other form of information, except in areas specifically Website authorised to do so.

                </li>

                <li>

                    Reproduce, duplicate, copy, sell, resell or exploit for commercial purposes in whole or in part, the contents of the Web Site without the express prior

                    authorisation.

                </li>

            </ul>



            <p>

                12.2. Users who take service through the Web Site should be legally of age according to the UK legislation.

            </p>



            <h2>13. Modifying information</h2>

            <p>

                Kontainers reserves the exclusive right to update, modify or delete the contents of the Web Site and the right to limit or block access to it. Kontainers

                may exercise such rights at any time and without notice.

            </p>



            <h2>14. Files</h2>

            <p>

                14.1. Kontainers undertakes to use its best efforts to avoid any errors in the content appearing on the Website. In any case, Kontainers be exempt from any

                liability for any errors in the contents that may appear on the Website.

            </p>

            <p>

                14.2. Kontainers assumes no responsibility for any discrepancies that may exist between the printed and electronic version published on the Website. In

                case of a discrepancy between the printed version and published on the website, the printed version shall prevail.

            </p>

            <p>

                14.3. Kontainers are not responsible in any way for the contents, commercial activities, products and services that can be viewed through electronic links

                (links) directly or indirectly, through the Web Site. The links on the Website, unless expressly stated otherwise, is for informational purposes only and

                in no way a suggestion, invitation or recommendation thereof. These links do not represent any type of relationship between Kontainers and individuals or

                business owners of the websites that can be accessed through these links. Kontainers reserves the right to withdraw unilaterally and at any time the links

                that appear on the Website.

            </p>

            <h2>14. Navigation, access and security</h2>

            <p>

                14.1. Kontainers makes every effort to ensure that browsing takes place under optimum conditions.

            </p>

            <p>

                14.2. This website has been designed to support the Internet Explorer and Chrome browser's. In this context, Kontainers are not responsible for damages of

                any kind that may be caused to users by using other browsers or different versions of the browsers for which designed the Website.

            </p>

            <p>

                14.3. Kontainers assumes no responsibility or guarantees that access to the Website will be uninterrupted or error free. Kontainers assumes no liability or

                guarantees that the content or software that can be accessed through the Web Site will be error-free and will not cause damage to the computer from which

                the user accessed. In any case Kontainers be liable for any loss or damages of any kind arising from the use of, and browsing the Site, including, without

                limitation, damage to computer systems or damage caused by the introduction virus. In particular, Kontainers not responsible in any way for breakdowns,

                interruptions, faults or defects in telecommunications that may occur in the course of operations or financial nature of those damages that could be

                generated in such cases.

            </p>

            <p>

                14.4. Kontainers not liable for damages caused to users through misuse of the Web Site.

            </p>

            <p>

                The services offered on the Website may only be used correctly if the technical specifications for which they were designed are met.

            </p>



            <h2>15. Privacy</h2>

            <p>

                15.1 For the purposes of Article 5 of Law 15/1999 of December 13, Protection of Personal Data (LOPD), Kontainers informs the user that all personal

                information provided at any time and for Voluntary our company or our employees will be included in an automated personal data created and maintained under

                the responsibility of Kontainers. This entity will treat the information as confidential and will be treated with the sole purpose of operating our

                business relationship with you and to send you information about the products and services in which you may be interested.

            </p>

            <p>

                15.2 Kontainers uses the use of cookies when the user navigates through the Website. Cookies are data files very limited capacity generated in the user's

                computer allowing to obtain the following information: (a) the date and time of the last time you visited the Website; (B) the design of content that the

                user chose in their first visit to the Website; (C) contact information; and (d) the security elements involved in controlling access to restricted

                areas.The user has the option to prevent the creation of cookies by selecting the appropriate option in your browser.

            </p>

            <p>

                15.3 Kontainers holds the database generated with the personal data provided by users. Kontainers agrees to comply at all times with the Data Protection

                Act with its obligation of secrecy of personal data and its duty to treat as confidential, and shall, for these purposes, the necessary measures to prevent

                alteration, loss, or unauthorised access, taking into account the current state of technology under the provisions of the legislation on protection of

                personal data that is applicable in UK at any given time. The user accepts that personal data provided at the time of applying for the benefit of any of

                our services to be included in an automated file whose ownership corresponds to Kontainers, in order to provide the requested service, and let you know any

                information could be of interest for other opportunities, products or news. Furthermore, the user consents to Kontainers transfer its data to other

                companies in its group, based in UK or abroad, for the sole purpose of being able to execute the agreed service, accepting that you can be informed of

                other services, offers and products that may be of interest.The user, in any case, the veracity of the data and is responsible for notifying Kontainers any

                changes in them, Kontainers reserves the right to exclude from the registered services to any advertiser who provides false data, without prejudice other

                actions stipulated by law. Finally, the user is informed that in order to exercise their rights of access, modification, cancellation and opposition may

                lead Kontainers a written request to the address listed above.

            </p>

            <h2>16. Information on technical aspects</h2>

            <p>

                Kontainers are not liable for any damages that may arise from interferences, omissions, interruptions, computer viruses, telephone breakdowns or

                disconnections in the operational functioning of this electronic system caused by reasons beyond Kontainers; delays or blockages in the use of this

                electronic system caused by deficiencies or overloading of its Data Processing Centre, telephone lines, the Internet system or other electronic systems;

                nor for any damage that may be caused by third parties through illegal interference beyond the control of Kontainers.

            </p>

            <p>

                Also Kontainers are not liable for any damage or harm caused to the user as a result of errors, defects or omissions in the information provided by

                Kontainers provided from outside sources. Kontainers are not responsible for the inappropriate use of the service as a result of maintenance, a faulty

                configuration of the user's computer or insufficient capacity to support the computer systems necessary for the use of services offered.

            </p>



            <h2>17. Intellectual property</h2>

            <p>

                Certain content that the user can access through the Web Site are subject to intellectual property rights and intellectual property of Kontainers or other

                owners of such rights. Access to this content or features through the Website does not give you the right to alter, amend, or exploitation reproduction,

                distribution, public communication or any other rights belonging to the holder of the right affected. The user undertakes to use the content and / or items

                to which you navigate from the Website for your own use and needs, and not engage in any commercial, direct or indirect exploitation thereof.

            </p>

            <p>

                Violation of any of these rights may constitute a violation of these provisions, as well as an offence punishable in accordance with the provisions of

                Articles 270 and following of the Penal Code.

            </p>

            <p>

                The claims filed by the users in relation to possible breaches of the rights of intellectual property on any of the Content of this Web Site should be

                addressed to the following email address: <a href="mailto:help@kontainers.co.uk">help@kontainers.co.uk</a>

            </p>



            <h2>18.  Withdrawal and suspension of services</h2>



            <p>

                Kontainers will be withdrawn or suspended at any time without prior notice, the provision of services to users who breach the provisions of these terms of

                use.

            </p>



            <h2>19. Duration and Termination</h2>

            <p>

                Providing services and information included in the Website are, in principle, indefinitely. Kontainers may terminate or suspend the service and / or any

                element of the Website at any time so that the validity of these conditions is limited to the time of exposure. When it is reasonably possible, warn users

                in advance of the termination or suspension of the provision of various services.

            </p>

            <h2>20. Governing Law</h2>

            <p>

                All questions arising between Kontainers and the user relating to the interpretation, enforcement and validity of the General Conditions shall be governed

                by their own terms and, as provided in them is not in accordance with UK law, expressly subjecting the parties to the jurisdiction of the Courts of the

                United Kingdom.

            </p>

            <p>

                If any provision of these Terms of Use is declared unlawful, void or unenforceable by a court decision, the remaining provisions shall remain in full force

                and effect.

            </p>

      </div>

	<item>
		<title>Cookie Policy</title>
		<link>https://kontainers.com/cookie-policy/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 09 Oct 2015 10:41:58 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[captain]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://home.kontainers.co.uk/?page_id=28</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<div class="form_holder">



  <div class="content_holder">

    <div class="row ">

      <div class="twelve columns">

      

        <h1>How Kontainers Manages Cookies</h1>

        

        

        

<div class="page-holder">

    <p>We use cookies and similar tools across our websites to improve their performance and enhance your user experience. This policy explains how we do that.</p>

<p><strong>What are cookies?</strong></p>

<p>Cookies are small text files which a website may put on your computer or mobile device when you first visit a site or page. The cookie will help the website, or another website, to recognise your device the next time you visit. Web beacons or other similar files can also do the same thing. We use the term cookies in this policy to refer to all files that collect information in this way.</p>

<p>There are many functions cookies serve. For example, they can help us to remember your username and preferences, analyse how well our website is performing, or even allow us to recommend content we believe will be most relevant to you.</p>

<p>Certain cookies contain personal information  for example if you click to remember me when logging in, a cookie will store your username. Most cookies wont collect information that identifies you, and will instead collect more general information such as how users arrive at and use our websites, or a users general location.</p>

<p><strong>What sort of cookies does Kontainers use?</strong></p>

<p>Generally, our cookies perform up to four different functions:</p>

<p><strong>1. Essential cookies</strong></p>

<p>Some cookies are essential for the operation of our website. For example, some cookies allow us to identify subscribers and ensure they can access the subscription only pages. If a subscriber opts to disable these cookies, the user will not be able to access all of the content that a subscription entitles them to.</p>

<p><strong>2. Performance Cookies</strong></p>

<p>We utilise other cookies to analyse how our visitors use our websites and to monitor website performance. This allows us to provide a high-quality experience by customising our offering and quickly identifying and fixing any issues that arise. For example, we might use performance cookies to keep track of which pages are most popular, which method of linking between pages is most effective, and to determine why some pages are receiving error messages. We might also use these cookies to highlight articles or site services that we think will be of interest to you based on your usage of the website.</p>

<p><strong>3. Functionality Cookies</strong></p>

<p>We use functionality cookies to allow us to remember your preferences. For example, cookies save you the trouble of typing in your username every time you access the site, and recall your customisation preferences, such as which regional edition of the website you want to see when you log in.</p>

<p>We also use functionality cookies to provide you with enhanced services such as allowing you to watch a video online or comment on a blog.</p>

<p><strong>Can a website user block cookies?</strong></p>

<p>As weve explained above, cookies help you to get the most out of our websites.</p>

<p>The first time you accessed our website after 1st July 2014, you should have seen an overlay which explained that by continuing to access our site, you are consenting to our use of cookies.</p>



<p>Please remember that if you do choose to disable cookies, you may find that certain sections of our website do not work properly</p>

<p><strong>More Information</strong></p>

<p>More detail on how businesses use cookies is available at<a href="http://allaboutcookies.org" target="_blank"> www.allaboutcookies.org</a>.</p>

<p>If you have any queries regarding this Cookie Policy please contact our Privacy Officer by e-mail at <a href="mailto:help@kontainers.co.uk" target="_blank">help@kontainers.co.uk</a>.</p>

<p>This document was last updated on 1st July 2014.</p>

      

     </div>

        

        

        

      </div>

    </div>

  </div>

<div class="footer">

      <a> Kontainers &copy; 2016 Cracking Logistics Limited. All rights reserved </a> 

    </div>

</div>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>28</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2015-10-09 11:41:58]]></wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2015-10-09 10:41:58]]></wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name><![CDATA[cookie-policy]]></wp:post_name>

		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>

		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[page]]></wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password><![CDATA[]]></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_edit_last]]></wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[3]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_wp_page_template]]></wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[default]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
	</item>
	<item>
		<title>The Future of Sea Freight Shipping</title>
		<link>https://kontainers.com/the-future-of-sea-freight-shipping/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 12 Oct 2015 10:36:41 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[captain]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://home.kontainers.co.uk/?p=37</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<h3 class="mobile-sub-heading">Say hello to the digital revolution</h3>

<p>Shipping and sea travel shaped the modern world. Without shipping, Renaissance Europe would have lacked the wealth to support great artists and thinkers.</p>



<p>In the 1700s, America would have remained an insignificant colony, had it not been for the steady and profitable Atlantic trade route. And today, where would we be without our ability to get everything, from Levi jeans to Apple iPads shipped from China?</p>



<p>But it isnt just jeans and iPads. <strong>Ninety percent of everything travels by ship, in millions of identical forty-foot containers</strong>. The Internet and air travel are essential, but if freight shipping were to stop tomorrow, we would look back at the recession with a longing for simpler times.</p>



<!--more-->

<p></p>



<h3>Sea Travel: Once Only for The Bold and the Crazy</h3>



<p>Sea travel was once only for explorers. Only the bold and the crazy would set off across the sea, hoping to discover a shorter route to India. Eventually, intrepid, or crazy, European explorers discovered that the world was a little bigger than what they had imagined; stumbling into the Americas and Australia along the way.</p>



<p>However, long before the age of exploration, most ancient empires, from Japan to Rome, had navys and merchant fleets.<.]/p>



<a href="https://flic.kr/p/g49HT9" target="_blank"><img class="alignnone size-full wp-image-320" style="width: 280px!important; float: right; margin: 10px 0px 20px 20px;" src="https://kontainers.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/10/ancient-merchant.jpg" alt="ancient-merchant" width="400" height="437" /></a>



<p>In most cases, the merchant fleets came first. Once ambitious leaders realised there were fortunes to plunder across the seas, navies were built to safeguard this new-found wealth. The Spanish, Portuguese, Dutch and British empires expanded along their trade routes.</p>



<p>Even after steam-power replaced sail, and later, diesel replaced steam, shipping remained - and still is - an isolated, hard, and dangerous industry. According to <a href="http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/0805092633/" target="_blank">Ninety Percent of Everything</a> author, <a href="http://www.smithsonianmag.com/ist/?next=/innovation/how-the-shipping-industry-is-the-secret-force-driving-the-world-economy-1950979/?page=1" target="_blank">Rose George</a>, <em>Sea faring has always been a very dangerous life. Youve got weather; youve got all sorts of hazards, and theres not a lot that modernity can do to alleviate that.</em></p>



<p>Most sailors dont even have Internet access until they reach port. They normally only have time for a quick Skype call home before theyre back on board.</p>



<p>Ships used to spend days, even weeks, in ports. But the fast pace of modern commerce means that idle time in foreign cities is a thing of the past for merchant sailors.</p>

  

  <p></p>

  

<h3>From Wooden Boxes, to Steel Containers</h3>

  

<p>In the 1950s, America was booming. Exports, to the regions still recovering from the war - Europe and Asia - were growing at an unprecedented rate. Transporting goods in barrels and crates, on pallets and in sacks (known as break-bulk shipping), couldnt keep up with consumer demand.</p>



<img class="alignnone size-full wp-image-319" src="https://kontainers.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/10/boxes.jpg" alt="From Wooden Boxes, to Steel Containers" />



<p>Described in Forbes as <em>one of the few men who changed the world</em>, <strong>the most prolific entrepreneur youve probably not heard of - Malcom McLean</strong>, had a solution that would revolutionise the industry. In 1956, the maiden voyage of a converted tanker, the Ideal X gave rise to the humble, but essential, shipping container.</p>



<p>In only a few short years, forty-foot steel containers could be found everywhere. Anywhere in the world there was a ship, a port, a railway line or road. Quite literally  <em>everywhere</em>.</p>



<p>This changed the industry profoundly, making container shipping costs inexpensive throughout, and transforming the industry into the fast, efficient business we know today.</p>

  

  <p></p>

  

<h3>Time for A New Revolution?</h3>

  

<p>Freight forwarders have always played a crucial role in this industry, with the top twenty generating billions in revenue, each. Sea freight is the only form of transport where you cant easily compare prices for shipping products from A to B.</p>



<p>You can with planes, trains and automobiles, even passenger ships. But you want to ship jeans from China to California? Normally, you would search for a freight forwarder. They spend time getting rates from various shipping lines - whether its an FCL or LCL quote, for a reefer container or ordinary, so that you can go with the most competitive, or fastest.</p>



<p>Quotes can change hourly. The price of fuel fluctuates, tolls to pay, canal fees, even weather can change the cost of sea freight. Once fees are paid, theres no accurate way to track your cargo, not until it arrives in port. In many respects, shipping has remained as much a gamble now as it was five hundred years ago  until now</p>

  

  <p></p>

  

<h3>Introducing A Digital Revolution</h3>

  

<p>Five hundred years ago, in Renaissance Europe, the wealth from shipping supported artists, innovators and entrepreneurs. The world has changed a lot since then. Shipping, not so much.</p>



<p>Now its time for entrepreneurs to support the industries transition into our fast-paced modern world. Technology has made it possible to buy goods from all over the world, so why not use technology to make shipping goods easier and faster?</p>



<p>The team behind Kontainers couldnt find a solution - so they built one.</p>



<p>The Kontainers team are technology driven, logistics smart, and creative individuals - people who think outside the box; and for an industry that was becoming all to comfortable with the notion of stagnation, its finally exciting to see new transformations taking place./p>



<a class="free-assessment" href="https://kontainers.com/freeshippingassessment" target="_blank"><img style="border-radius: 8px; box-shadow: 0 8px 0 -0.5px #5b6b7c; margin-top: 28px;" src="https://kontainers.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/01/shipping-assessment-cta.jpg" alt="Free Shipping Assessment" /></a>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

	</item>
	<item>
		<title>The Storm is Intensifying</title>
		<link>https://kontainers.com/the-storm-is-intensifying/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 03 Nov 2015 15:10:02 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[captain]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://kontainers.com/?p=346</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<h3 class="mobile-sub-heading">Guest Blogger: Lars Jensen</h3>





<div class="post-note">

<p>To share some insight on how the shipping industry has been afflicted by the ever-fluctuating rates of container shipments, we reached out to Lars Jensen to get his take on the matter. Lars is CEO and Partner of SeaIntelligence Consulting, which is focused on providing expert assistance in strategic decision making and revenue management within the container shipping sector. Additionally, he is CEO and founder of CyberKeel, as well as founder of publishing house Vespucci Maritime Publishing and author of the book Culture Shock in Maersk Line.</p>

</div>





<p>Freight shipping is in the midst of one of the industrys most challenging periods. Several years of low demand growth combined with large amounts of new vessels has destabilized the trade  and there is no short-term solution in sight.</em> </p>



<!--more-->  

<p></p>

<h3>The storm is intensifying</h3>

<p>It is by now not news to anyone in the industry that container shipping costs are extremely volatile. Nor is it news that they appear to be collapsing quite frequently. </p>



<p>However, looking more closely at the developments in the past 5 years, it is very clear that 2014-2015 has seen a very sharp  and worsening  trend in essentially all major deep-sea trades out of Asia.</p>



<p>As an illustration, the attached graph shows the weekly rate changes in the trade from Asia to North Europe for weeks wherein rates have declined. The development seen is very clear.</p>



<img src="https://kontainers.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/11/lars-graph-1024x539.jpg" alt="lars-graph"  class="alignnone size-large wp-image-465" />



<p>From 2010 to 2013, weekly rate declines tended to be less than 5%. In 2013 to mid-2014, this doubled to 10%. Then from mid-2014 to the present date, the weekly erosion rate has constantly increased to the point where a weekly rate decline of a staggering 25-30% is no longer uncommon.</p>



<p>For other trades such as the Transpacific, Asia to Australia, and Asia to East Coast South America, the same trend is seen.</p>



<p>A key question is whether this trend will continue, and looking at just a few key numbers the answer unfortunately appears to be a clear yes.</p>



<p>According to <a href="https://www.containerstatistics.com/" target="_blank">Container Trade Statistics</a>, global demand for container transportation has grown a paltry 0.9% in the first 8 months of 2015. Against this is an expected fleet growth of 8.8% in 2015.</p>



<p>Hence the combination of continued excessive capacity growth when compared to actual demand developments, and a fuel price which is once more rapidly declining, leads to the inevitable outlook that the storm the industry has been experiencing as of late is not abating, but intensifying rather.</p>



<p>For the shippers this means they need to prepare for two key challenges. On one hand sea freight rates are likely to become even more volatile. On the other hand, the overcapacity will result in more frequent service changes  and cancellations  from the container carriers. This in turn means the shippers need to prepare themselves for a very agile setup in relation to the ocean part of their supply chains.</p>



<div class="foot-note">

<p>Written by Lars Jensen for <a href="https://kontainers.com/">Kontainers</a>.</p>



<p>Lars Jensen has over 14 years of experience from inside the container shipping industry which covers a combined period of 8 years as Director of driving and developing market intelligence & analysis for Maersk Line, Maersk Logistics and The Containership Company.</p>

</div>



<a href="https://kontainers.com" class="blog-cta" style="margin: 48px 0 -34px 0!important; display: block;">

<h1 style="padding: 20px 20px 20px 30px!important;  position: relative!important; background-color: #0e171e!important; max-width: 688px!important; border-radius: 8px!important; color: #fff!important; text-shadow: none!important; max-width: 100%!important; z-index: 9999999!important; display: block; margin: 0px 0 -150px 0;!important; font-size: 28px; font-family: "bclever_font_light", tahoma, sans-serif!important;">Learn more about the Kontainers online platform and how we're pushing shipping to the 21st century</h1>

<img src="https://kontainers.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/10/cta.jpg" alt="Learn more about the Kontainers online platform" class="alignnone size-large wp-image-324" /></a>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>346</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2015-11-03 15:10:02]]></wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2015-11-03 15:10:02]]></wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[open]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[open]]></wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name><![CDATA[the-storm-is-intensifying]]></wp:post_name>
		<wp:status><![CDATA[publish]]></wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[post]]></wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password><![CDATA[]]></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
		<category domain="category" nicename="blog"><![CDATA[Blog]]></category>
		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_edit_last]]></wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[3]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_thumbnail_id]]></wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[474]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_aioseop_keywords]]></wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[freight forwarder, container shipping costs, freight shipping, reefer container, LCL quote, sea freight]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_aioseop_description]]></wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[The shipping industry has been afflicted by the ever-fluctuating rates. We reached out to Lars Jensen to get his take on the matter.]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_aioseop_title]]></wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[The Storm is Intensifying]]></wp:meta_value>

		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_yoast_wpseo_metadesc]]></wp:meta_key>

		</wp:postmeta>

			<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_yoast_wpseo_metakeywords]]></wp:meta_key>
