	</item>
	<item>
		<title>How Modern Day Piracy Impacts Freight Shipping</title>
		<link>https://kontainers.com/how-modern-day-piracy-impacts-freight-shipping/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 02 Feb 2016 15:40:30 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[pete@kontainers.co.uk]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://kontainers.com/?p=836</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<h3 class="mobile-sub-heading">What Can Sea Freight Ships Do</h3>

 

<p><strong>Some countries are, surprisingly, known for exporting <a href="https://kontainers.com/what-are-the-most-popular-exports/" target=_blank">feta cheese (Canada), whisky (Japan) or Kiwis (Italy)</a>. Somalia, on the other hand, has unfortunately from the years gone by, become known for exporting piracy and terrorism.  </strong></p>



<p>When news of piracy first broke into the media spotlight several years back, many might have been surprised to hear that it still existed within the modern world. Several hundred years ago, during the age of discovery (15th - 18th century), piracy was commonplace. Merchants ships were regularly assailed on the seas by pirates and privateers - pirates in all but name, protected by law - particularly around the Caribbean, Mediterranean, and Atlantic seaboard. Indeed, pirates and privateers were an extension of the foreign and military policies of most European powers; a way of exerting influence, even covertly attacking foreign rivals. </p>



<!--more--> 



<img src="https://kontainers.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/02/pirates-in-history.jpg" alt="pirates in freight shipping history" class="alignnone size-full wp-image-840" />



<p>In time, navies started to crack down on piracy and governments, until there came the time that a pirates life was no more. It wasnt until the modern age, when economic necessity forced some in war-torn countries, such as Somalia, into piracy.  </p>





<p>In 2009, an American ship with 20 crew, was hijacked off the coast of Somalia, already a known piracy hot spot. The ordeal became inspiration for the Hollywood movie, Captain Phillips. In one scene, the captain, played by Tom Hanks, laments why piracy as a way of life: <em>Theres got to be something other than being a fisherman and kidnapping people.</em> </p>





<p><em>Maybe in America,</em> was the reply of his captor. </p>





<p></p>





<img src="https://kontainers.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/02/captain-phillips.jpg" alt="captain phillips - freight shipping pirates" class="alignnone size-full wp-image-842" />



<p>The ordeal of the Maersk Alabama is not unlike what numerous other ships have faced in that region, or in any region where modern-day pirates patrol the waters looking for easy prey and lucrative ransoms. Piracy costs everyone money, forcing up the cost of sea freight and container shipping costs since freight forwarders and shipping lines need to pass on the extra cost of insurance to clients. </p>





<p></p>







<h3>Why Somalia?</h3>





<p>Sadly, Somalia has been described as a textbook definition of a failed state, ever since the disastrous civil war in 1991 - a country where an entire generation has been raised to believe that violence is the rule in life, not the exception, according to journalists with first-hand experience in the country.</p>





<p>Mohamed Kalombi, interior minister for the Puntland region, told The Telegraph in 2014, that with no jobs and no prospects, young people see piracy as a way to get out of poverty.</p>





<p>One pirate interview for the same article confirmed that, <em>I became a pirate because I realised it was the only way a Somali like me can make good money. I can afford to buy a new car and home, and when we are back on shore we have big parties with girls, lots to drink, and plenty of qhat [a narcotic leaf chewed by people of that region].</em></p>





<p>Western-owned and insured freight ships are an opportunity that the young and the desperate, in a country with few other prospects, cant pass on. Despite the dangers, ransom money paid from corporate insurance policies, result in significant pay days for everyone - including local communities and investors. </p>





<p></p>





<img src="https://kontainers.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/02/somalian-pirates.jpg" alt="somalian sea freight pirates"  class="alignnone size-full wp-image-844" />



<p>In 2010 alone, piracy was responsible for an estimated $300 million worth of profit, making it a significant informal economic activity. In the port town of Haradheere, a stock exchange exists where people can contribute weapons or money to pirate crews, receiving a return if they secure a ransom payment. </p>







<p>The Economist reported that the average ransom is $2.7 million per ship, with pirates receiving between $30,000 and $75,000. Whats more, there are community benefits too. According to Somalia, the New Barbary?, author, Martin Murphy, a local official he interviewed said <em>The district gets a percentage of every ransom from ships that have been released and that goes on public infrastructure, including our hospital and public schools.</em></p>





<p>Although piracy peaked in 2011, its still a viable economic activity and as we can see from the map below, not limited to the East Coast of Africa. </p>





<p></p>





<img src="https://kontainers.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/02/IMB-Piracy-Armed-Robbery-Map-2014.jpg" style="border: 1px solid #ccc; box-shadow: 3px 3px 3px 0px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.18);" alt="Freight Shipping Piracy Armed Robbery Map 2014" class="alignnone size-full wp-image-849" />



<p>A map from 2014 shows the same high concentration of pirate activity on the West Coast of Africa, Indian Ocean, Indonesia and South East Asia. Piracy emanating from Somalia has reduced since 2011, but Somali pirates are known to cover a wide range.</p>





<p></p>



<img src="https://kontainers.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/02/IMB-Piracy-Armed-Robbery-Map-2015.jpg" style="border: 1px solid #ccc; box-shadow: 3px 3px 3px 0px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.18);" alt="Freight Shipping Piracy Armed Robbery Map 2015" class="alignnone size-full wp-image-851" />



<h3>What Can Sea Freight Ships Do? </h3>





<p>Piracy, although less of a problem than it was in 2011, still poses a risk to sea freight, oil, and cargo ships. Pirates dont kill, plunder and pillage like they did centuries ago, but they do hold ships and crews to ransom.</p>





<p>A terrifying ordeal for the crew, it delays the delivery of cargo and costs everyone involved in the supply chain, including the insurance companies a lot of money. Ships sailing through waters known for trouble often carry, where necessary, armed men on deck, as a deterrent.</p>





<p>To avoid delays and extra costs, sea freight lines have also upgraded satellite and other scanning systems that watch out for hostile ships. No matter what the cargo, ships are safer than they were in the past. Container vessels in risky waters also stay in closer contact, ensuring each is watching out for others in the area. Unfortunately, the shipping industry cant fix the social problems in countries where piracy originates, but it can work with the international community and NGOs to protect the lives of merchant sailors and the cargo they are entrusted with.</p>





<h4>Sources</h4>

<p><a href="http://www.telegraph.co.uk/sponsored/culture/captain-phillips-film/10367538/somali-piracy-reasons-causes.html " target="_blank">http://telegraph.co.uk/sponsored/culture/captain-phillips-film/10367538/somali-piracy-reasons-causes.html </a><br />



<a href="http://www.studentpulse.com/articles/579/somali-piracy-causes-and-consequences" target="_blank">http://studentpulse.com/articles/579/somali-piracy-causes-and-consequences</a><br />



<a href="http://mic.com/articles/72317/5-things-you-never-knew-about-modern-day-pirates#.paL2BJACD" target="_blank">http://mic.com/articles/72317/5-things-you-never-knew-about-modern-day-pirates#.paL2BJACD</a><br />



<a href="http://www.newyorker.com/magazine/2015/04/20/escape-or-die" target="_blank">http://www.newyorker.com/magazine/2015/04/20/escape-or-die</a></p>









<a class="free-assessment" href="https://kontainers.com/freeshippingassessment" target="_blank"><img  style="border-radius: 8px; box-shadow: 0 8px 0 -0.5px #5b6b7c; margin-top: 28px;" src="https://kontainers.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/02/shipping-assessment-cta.jpg" alt="Free Shipping Assessment"  /></a>]]></content:encoded>

		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[open]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[open]]></wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name><![CDATA[how-modern-day-piracy-impacts-freight-shipping]]></wp:post_name>
		<wp:status><![CDATA[publish]]></wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[post]]></wp:post_type>

			<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_edit_last]]></wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[3]]></wp:meta_value>

		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_thumbnail_id]]></wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[858]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>

			<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_aioseop_keywords]]></wp:meta_key>

			<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_yoast_wpseo_metakeywords]]></wp:meta_key>

	</item>
	<item>
		<title>5 Reasons to Love Shipping This Valentines Day</title>
		<link>https://kontainers.com/5-reasons-to-love-shipping-this-valentines-day/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 10 Feb 2016 15:46:28 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[pete@kontainers.co.uk]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://kontainers.com/?p=889</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<h3 class="mobile-sub-heading">Shipping &amp; Saints Day</h3>

<p><strong>Love it or hate it, which may depend on whether you are single or not on February 14, Valentines Day is fast approaching. </strong></p>



<p>Although the origins of the date, a Saints Day, first established in 496 by Pope Gelasius I is lost in Ancient Roman mythology, along with records of the Saint himself - Valentines Day has become one of the most lavish consumer holidays in the world.</p>



<!--more-->

<p style="margin-top: -28px;">In America alone, the average consumer spends $116.21 on gifts, meals, entertainment, and course, flowers. Roses are especially popular, with U.S. imports, mainly from Columbia to the Port of Miami, increasing 66%, to $138 million in February.</p>



<h3>Without shipping, Valentines Day simply wouldnt be possible.</h3>

<p>Total spending has been steadily increasing around every 14 February in recent years, with $18.9 billion spent in 2015. Only four years prior, in 2011, spending was at $15.7 billion in the U.S. Consumers in the UK are expected to spend around $1.9 billion in 2016.</p>



<p>As well as this being a busy time of year for flower growers and florists, heres seven more reasons to give our love to shipping this time of year.</p>



<img class="alignnone size-full wp-image-892" src="https://kontainers.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/02/chocolates.jpg" alt="shipping chocolates" />

<h3>#1: Chocolate</h3>

<p>Some call this a Valentines classic. Others on diets or still shedding the extra Christmas pounds could do without the calories, but this is still a multi-billion dollar import - export market.</p>



<p>Canada alone exports $1 billion worth of chocolates while importing $1.3 billion during a year, with sales going up during Valentines.</p>



<p>Profits on chocolates reach over $1.1 billion during February, with the majority of cocoa beans imported from Western African countries (The Ivory Coast, Ghana, etc.). Americans are expected to spend over $700 million on chocolates alone this year.</p>



<img class="alignnone size-full wp-image-893" src="https://kontainers.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/02/champaign.jpg" alt="Champagne" />

<h3>#2: Champagne</h3>

<p>True Champagne can only come from one region of France, making it a valuable export product, especially this time of year. The UK alone will import around $994 million worth of Champagne 2016, with sales spiking in February.</p>



<p>Most countries see a similar spike in sales, making it the most popular holiday for fizzy grown up drinks after New Years Eve.</p>



<img class="alignnone size-full wp-image-894" src="https://kontainers.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/02/Jewellery.jpg" alt="Diamonds and Jewellery " />

<h3>#3: Diamonds and Jewellery</h3>

<p>Jewellery is the second most popular gift after chocolates, with consumers - mostly men - expected to spend over $3.5 billion for Valentines Day. This means around 17.3% of women are likely to get bracelets, necklaces, earrings and other types of jewellery on 14 February.</p>



<p>Many of which would have started as gold, silver and diamonds in mines around the world, before being shipped to factories and into the stores.</p>



<p>According to a U.S. National Retail Federation survey, around 11% of Americans get engaged on Valentines Day.</p>



<img class="alignnone size-full wp-image-895" src="https://kontainers.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/02/valentine-card.jpg" alt="Cards" />

<h3>#4: Cards</h3>

<p>Although not as popular as Christmas, 141 million cards are exchanged on Valentines Day, with 52.1% of people choosing to buy them. Many, are exported, from printers in China, with around 174 forty-foot shipping containers carrying Americas Valentines cards.</p>



<a href="https://kontainers.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/02/pets.jpg"><img class="alignnone size-full wp-image-896" src="https://kontainers.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/02/pets.jpg" alt="Gifts for Pets" width="1024" height="636" /></a>

<h3>#5: Gifts for Pets</h3>

<p>Pets are also showered with love on this day. In 2015, $700 million was spent on pets for Valentines with the most popular products including dog (or cat) collars, pet chocolates and treats, costumes and food bowls.</p>



<p>Whatever you do and, however, much you buy, whether for a loved one, a pet - or just yourself, because why not!? - give a thought to the tireless shipping agents, crew, and captains that get much of what you buy in the shops and online safely into port.</p>

<h4>Sources</h4>

<a href="http://www.business2community.com/trends-news/valentines-day-spending-statistics-2015-01153592#UGcF28v6AfwJIBtX.97 " target="_blank">http://www.business2community.com/trends-news/valentines-day-spending-statistics-2015-01153592#UGcF28v6AfwJIBtX.97 </a>



<a href="http://www.businessinsider.com/valentines-day-spending-2011-2?op=1&amp;IR=T " target="_blank">http://www.businessinsider.com/valentines-day-spending-2011-2?op=1&amp;IR=T </a>



<a href="http://businesslife.ba.com/Ideas/Features/Lovenomics-the-business-of-Valentines-Day.html " target="_blank">http://businesslife.ba.com/Ideas/Features/Lovenomics-the-business-of-Valentines-Day.html </a>



<a href="http://www.geolounge.com/economic-geography-valentines-day-chocolate/ " target="_blank">http://www.geolounge.com/economic-geography-valentines-day-chocolate/ </a>



<a href="http://www.business2community.com/trends-news/valentines-day-spending-statistics-2015-01153592#coDwS2Hf5vYdZlMA.97 " target="_blank">http://www.business2community.com/trends-news/valentines-day-spending-statistics-2015-01153592#coDwS2Hf5vYdZlMA.97</a>



<a href="http://www.buzzfeed.com/dfatdcanada/7-imports-and-exports-that-make-valentineas-day-tltc " target="_blank">http://www.buzzfeed.com/dfatdcanada/7-imports-and-exports-that-make-valentineas-day-tltc</a>



<a class="free-assessment" href="https://kontainers.com/freeshippingassessment" target="_blank"><img style="border-radius: 8px; box-shadow: 0 8px 0 -0.5px #5b6b7c; margin-top: 28px;" src="https://kontainers.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/02/shipping-assessment-cta.jpg" alt="Free Shipping Assessment" /></a>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>889</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2016-02-10 15:46:28]]></wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2016-02-10 15:46:28]]></wp:post_date_gmt>

		</wp:postmeta>
		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_aioseop_opengraph_settings]]></wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[a:12:{s:32:"aioseop_opengraph_settings_title";s:0:"";s:31:"aioseop_opengraph_settings_desc";s:0:"";s:36:"aioseop_opengraph_settings_customimg";s:0:"";s:37:"aioseop_opengraph_settings_imagewidth";s:0:"";s:38:"aioseop_opengraph_settings_imageheight";s:0:"";s:32:"aioseop_opengraph_settings_video";s:0:"";s:37:"aioseop_opengraph_settings_videowidth";s:0:"";s:38:"aioseop_opengraph_settings_videoheight";s:0:"";s:35:"aioseop_opengraph_settings_category";s:7:"article";s:34:"aioseop_opengraph_settings_section";s:0:"";s:30:"aioseop_opengraph_settings_tag";s:0:"";s:34:"aioseop_opengraph_settings_setcard";s:7:"summary";}]]></wp:meta_value>

	</item>
	<item>
		<title>Are You Ready for SOLAS Container Weight Verification?</title>
		<link>https://kontainers.com/are-you-ready-for-solas-container-weight-verification/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 16 Feb 2016 16:26:31 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[pete@kontainers.co.uk]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://kontainers.com/?p=937</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<h3 class="mobile-sub-heading">Safety of Life at Sea</h3>

 

<p><strong>In May 2014, the International Maritime Organisations (IMO) Maritime Safety Committee (MSC) approved changes to the rules governing the weight of sea freight containers.</strong></p>



<p>Right now, the weight of containers needs no verification before loading. Despite the fact that shipping lines and port representatives regularly report cargo weights of ships to be 3-7% above declared weight. At times this can be as high as 10% over the weight a sea freight vessel should be carrying. </p>



<!--more--> 







<h3>Risks of overloaded containers </h3>



<p>The World Shipping Council (WSC) and International Chamber of Shipping (ICS) took a stand on this issue in 2010, urging the IMO to take action. Not only does the problem of overweight containers impact ships, but cranes, trucks, and trains are also affected. Overloaded intermodal containers represent a danger to public safety, at sea, and on land.</p>



<p>The damage is widespread. Ships weighed down with a higher than expected gross tonnage are slower in the water and reduce efficiency, causing increased emissions and pollution. Supply chains encounter delays, or at times cargos need to be reconfigured, or cancelled altogether, resulting in further costs, insurance claims, and reimbursements.</p>



<p>Jorge Martn, an engineer with over twenty years experience in the industry, writing in Port Strategy, said that, <em>While all these risks are present within our supply chain today, their effect is multiplied at a larger scale.</em> Given the size of new ships, such as the CMA CGM Benjamin Franklin, which can carry 18,000 containers when full - the risk is too significant when multiplied. </p>



<p></p>



<img src="https://kontainers.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/02/frieght-ship-overload.jpg" alt="Overloaded sea freight ship" width="1024" height="636" class="alignnone size-full wp-image-941" />



<p>Containers are also regularly lost overboard. There are an estimated 10,000 containers lost at sea every year. A report from the US Office of National Marine Sanctuaries cited miscalculated weight as one of the main reasons for 41,500 tons of steel littering the world's oceans, along with up to <em>100,000 tons of substances in packaged form  many of which may be harmful   falling off ships in containers each year.</em> </p>



<p>Not all of these UFOs, unidentified floating objects, as they are known in France, sink straight away. Many sit just below the surface, presenting a serious hazard to yachts and smaller boats. According to a New Zealand insurance company, a 20-foot container would need to weigh 16 tons before sinking, whereas a 40-foot container would need to weigh 32 tons. Imagine the danger an overloaded container poses on our roads and railway lines, in busy urban areas. </p>



<p>Potential lost revenue, fines, and liability claims are the least of the industries concerns when it comes to the sea freights weight issue.</p>





<p></p>



<img src="https://kontainers.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/02/solas-agreement.jpg" alt="SOLAS agreement" width="1024" height="636" class="alignnone size-full wp-image-942" />



<h3>The solution: Safety of Life at Sea (SOLAS) cargo weight amendments </h3>



<p>After a period of consultation, the IMO agreed to amend the SOLAS Convention (Chapter V, Part A, Regulation 2); this will come into effect on 1 July 2016. </p>



<p>According to the new law, the shipper of the container must provide a verified weight to the sea freight company and port representative. The WSC has issued a statement one year to the date before these laws are due to come into effect: </p>







<p><em>A verified container weight is a condition for loading a packed container aboard a vessel for export. The vessel operator and the terminal operator are required to use verified container weights in vessel stowage plans and are prohibited from loading a packed container aboard a vessel for export if the container does not have a verified container weight.</em> </p>



<p>The rules are pretty clear: dont estimate because the cargo wont get on-board. You can either weigh a container after it has been packed or weigh the contents before packing, then add this figure to the containers tare weight on the door. </p>



<p>

Only then, with verification in hand, can containers be loaded onto a ship. Industry specialists, sea freight container companies, port operators, and regulatory bodies have been working since SOLAS changes were announced to prepare for implementation.</p>



<p>

Container weight verification requirements for vessel loading will become legally binding on July 1, 2016.</p>







<h4>Sources</h4>

<p>

<a href="http://money.cnn.com/2016/01/31/news/economy/china-container/index.html" target="_blank">http://money.cnn.com/2016/01/31/news/economy/china-container/index.html</a><br />



<a href="http://allportcargoservices.com/retailnews/allport-knowledge/regulatory-news/container-weight-rules-may-cause-problems-for-years/801656802" target="_blank">http://allportcargoservices.com/retailnews/allport-knowledge/regulatory-news/container-weight-rules-may-cause-problems-for-years/801656802</a><br />



<a href="http://www.worldshipping.org/industry-issues/safety/" target="_blank">http://www.worldshipping.org/industry-issues/safety/</a><br />

<a href="" target="_blank"></a><br />



<a href="http://www.worldshipping.org/public-statements/solving_the_problem_of_overweight_containers_for_release.pdf" target="_blank">http://www.worldshipping.org/public-statements/solving_the_problem_of_overweight_containers_for_release.pdf</a><br />



<a href="http://www.worldshipping.org/public-statements/" target="_blank">http://www.worldshipping.org/public-statements/</a><br />



<a href="http://www.worldshipping.org/industry-issues/safety/cargo-weight" target="_blank">http://www.worldshipping.org/industry-issues/safety/cargo-weight</a><br />



<a href="http://www.yachtingworld.com/blogs/elaine-bunting/shipping-containers-lost-at-sea-61867" target="_blank">http://www.yachtingworld.com/blogs/elaine-bunting/shipping-containers-lost-at-sea-61867</a>



</p>









<a class="free-assessment" href="https://kontainers.com/freeshippingassessment" target="_blank"><img  style="border-radius: 8px; box-shadow: 0 8px 0 -0.5px #5b6b7c; margin-top: 28px;" src="https://kontainers.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/02/shipping-assessment-cta.jpg" alt="Free Shipping Assessment"  /></a>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>A Second Life for Shipping Containers?</title>
		<link>https://kontainers.com/a-second-life-for-shipping-containers/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 23 Feb 2016 09:38:38 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[pete@kontainers.co.uk]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://kontainers.com/?p=950</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<h3 class="mobile-sub-heading">Container Architecture</h3>

<p><strong>During the 1960s and 70s, the hundreds of small rural railway lines that crisscrossed the UK started to disappear. The car and motorways became a primary mode of consumer transport. Freight once carried in wooden cargo trains, was loaded onto trucks and driven along new A and B roads. </strong></p>



<p>Rural railways were no longer needed. Neither were the freight boxes that were a common sight on those lines. In the spirit of make do and mend, those thousands of wooden freight boxes found a second life. Even today, in allotments and fields, often by the side of roads, you can see these sturdy containers enjoying their rebirth as sheds, storage units, and farm outbuildings.</p>



<!--more-->

<p style="margin-top: -28px;">It seems that their predecessor, the shipping container, can also enjoy a second life once they are repurposed.</p>

<p>Across the world, people have found ingenious ways to turn old containers into homes, apartments, and offices. Although most are in use carrying products around the world, these repurposing projects show that even shipping containers can make beautiful and comfortable homes.</p>



<p>One impressive example is <strong>Container City in East London</strong></p>.



<img class="alignnone size-full wp-image-953" src="https://kontainers.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/02/Container-City.jpg" alt="Container City" />



<p>Home to around 70 people, opposite the O2 Arena in Trinity Buoy Wharf, is a stack of multi-coloured containers four storeys high. Container City was dreamt up by Eric Reynolds, founder of Urban Space Management. Speaking to The Telegraph about his creation, he said, <em>We buy the containers in China. They earn their passage by coming over to the UK full of fridges or whatever,</em> and after the cost of conversion, <em>they work out at 850-950 per square metre.</em> The sea freight and freight shipping industry have, inadvertently, created a new architectural movement.</p>



<p>Most containers measure 40-45 square metres. The cost of a studio-style apartment is between 38,000 and 47,000, meaning rent, notoriously high in London, is between 600 and 1,000 per month.</p>



<p>Artistic communities may be the early adopters, but clearly there is a growing demand. <em>With affordable housing ever harder to find, my organisation is getting more inquiries from people wanting to put these container homes in their own back gardens. Often, theyre parents providing their grown-up children with a place to live that isnt the parental home,</em> said Reynolds. The price of the container shipping costs and freight forwarders fees are built into construction costs, still making the design and build of these homes and apartments considerably more affordable than traditional materials.</p>



<p>Not all designs keep containers in their original format - some involve the removal of walls and the topmost surface, creating high ceilings and patio doors, similar to open plan, modern homes. Container City is far from the only example of shipping containers being used to create new homes. Lets take a look at some around the world.</p>



<p><strong>New Jerusalem Orphanage, South Africa:</strong> Made from 28 shipping containers</p>



<img class="alignnone size-full wp-image-955" src="https://kontainers.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/02/Jerusalem-Orphanage.jpg" alt="Jerusalem Orphanage" />



<p>Tonys Organic Farm, Shanghai, China: The largest organic farm in Shanghai, made from 78 repurposed containers. Currently the largest container-built project in the world, demonstrating a cost affective modular building format. Although architects are experimenting with containers, they take cues from modern design trends and environmental practices.</p>



<img class="alignnone size-full wp-image-956" src="https://kontainers.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/02/tonys-farm.jpg" alt="Tonys Farm" />



<p>Architect, Marcio Kogan, designed this <strong>container house that embraces its inner container and original colour scheme</strong>.</p>



<img class="alignnone size-full wp-image-958" src="https://kontainers.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/02/Marcio-Kogan.jpg" alt="Marcio Kogan" width="1024" height="636" />



<p><strong>A winter getaway in Quebec, Canada:</strong> Built with 7 containers.</p>



<img class="alignnone size-full wp-image-959" src="https://kontainers.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/02/Snow-Fort-Quebec.jpg" alt="Snow Fort - Quebec" />



<p>Containers can even create homes in <strong>The Hamptons, New York: one of the worlds most desirable areas of real estate</strong>.</p>



<img class="alignnone size-full wp-image-961" src="https://kontainers.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/02/Beach-House-Hamptons.jpg" alt="Beach House - Hamptons" />



<p><strong>Box Office</strong>, Providence, RI; designed by Distill Studio, and developed by Truth Box, Inc.</p>



<p>Recognised internationally as a step forward for green design, the Box Office includes numerous green features, including a <strong>well-insulated, super tight exterior with high-performance windows and doors, high-efficiency air source heat pumps in each unit, and energy recovery ventilators (ERV) to conserve energy and to provide fresh air.</strong></p>



<img class="alignnone size-full wp-image-962" src="https://kontainers.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/02/Box-Office.jpg" alt="Box Office" />



<p>Cheap to build, efficient with space, adaptable and easy to make green and energy efficient: containers are the architectural gift that keeps on giving. These are just a handful of examples of what can be done with shipping containers. With rising urban populations and higher urban density, are repurposed containers a niche building solution, or are we going to see more of them in the years to come?</p>



<a class="free-assessment" href="https://kontainers.com/freeshippingassessment" target="_blank"><img style="border-radius: 8px; box-shadow: 0 8px 0 -0.5px #5b6b7c; margin-top: 28px;" src="https://kontainers.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/02/shipping-assessment-cta.jpg" alt="Free Shipping Assessment" /></a>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>The Top 10 Imports &amp; Exports in UK Trade</title>
		<link>https://kontainers.com/the-top-10-imports-exports-in-uk-trade/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 26 Apr 2016 08:00:19 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[pete@kontainers.co.uk]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://kontainers.com/?p=991</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<h3 class="mobile-sub-heading">Global trade to and from the United Kingdom</h3>

 

<p><strong>The UK has always been a trading country. Over the centuries, conquerors and merchants from the continent were attracted by a wealth of possibilities, from gold to iron ore, wool to petrochemicals.</strong></p>



<p>As a small, wet island on the edge of Europe, trade was how the UK established an outsized economic, military and political role in the world. Without the merchant adventurers of London, there would have been no empire.</p>



<!--more--> 









<p style="margin-top: -28px;">Entrepreneurs regularly risked life and fortune in the hope that someone overseas would buy British-made goods in exchange for products they could sell at home. Many died or lost all they had in the attempt but gradually, the age of exploration established the foundations for unprecedented periods of prosperity with the last drawing to a close in the previous century. </p>





<p></p>



<h3>UKs Top Trading Partners </h3>



<p>International trade, however, didn't relent. The merchant fleet recovered after World War II. America was keen to ensure that the UK remain a key trading partner, which was still possible in the decades it took Europe to recover, thanks to the Marshall Plan. Ever since, the UK and US trade links have played an important role in the economies of both countries. Despite the UKs proximity to the Eurozone, the US is at the top of this list for export destinations: </p>



<img src="https://kontainers.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/03/UK-Top-5-Export-Trading-Partners.jpg" alt="UK Top 5 Export Trading Partners"  class="alignnone size-full wp-image-1009" />



<p>America is also in the list of top import originating countries for the UK: </p>



<img src="https://kontainers.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/03/UK-Top-5-Import-Trading-Partners.jpg" alt="UK-Top-5-Import-Trading-Partners"  class="alignnone size-full wp-image-1010" />



<p>According to the latest data from HM Revenue & Customs (Overseas Trade Statistics), here are the top 10 imports and exports for 2015, with their respective values. </p>

  

  <img src="https://kontainers.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/03/top-10-uk-imports-infographic.jpg" alt="Top 10 uk imports"  class="alignnone size-full wp-image-1012" />

  

  <img src="https://kontainers.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/03/top-10-uk-exports-infographic.jpg" alt="Top 10 uk export infographic"  class="alignnone size-full wp-image-1014" />

  

  



<p>For decades, the UK has imported more than it has sold through exports, resulting in the country running an ever widening negative trade balance. Although the trade deficit showed some improvement in 2015, a combination of factors has forced it to widen once again early in 2016, causing some alarm amongst manufacturers. </p>

  

  

  

<img  src="https://kontainers.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/03/trade-balance.jpg" alt="UK Trade balance 2013"  class="alignnone size-full wp-image-1018" />

  

  

  

  <p>Zach Wilton, deputy chief economist at the EEF, the Manufacturers Organisation, said <em>Exports are set to remain under pressure from weak demand flowing from slower growth in emerging markets, particularly China. Yet stronger economic growth in the US and the Eurozone should provide some support.</em></p>



<img style="border: 1px solid #ccc; box-shadow: 3px 3px 3px 0px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.18);" src="https://kontainers.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/03/UK-balance-of-trade-1999-2014.jpg" alt="UK Trade Balance"  class="alignnone size-full wp-image-1016" />

  

  



<p>The government is eager to encourage more SMEs (small and medium sized enterprises) to start exporting, a policy it is carrying out through UK Trade & Industry (UKTI). There has never been a better time to sell goods and services abroad, with the Internet and social media making it easy for companies of any size to connect with customers abroad. </p>



<p>Once companies start selling products overseas, they will most likely encounter freight forwarders sooner or later. When an export order is too large and expensive to be sent via air freight, the only option is sea freight, which is how 90% of the worlds goods are transported. </p>

  

  

  <p>Forwarders are the gatekeepers, controlling access to shipping lines, with prices fluctuating hourly, making it impossible to know whether exporters are getting a good price since theres no transparency. </p>





<p>New technology and platforms are putting transparency and control in the customers hands, making quotes instantaneous, comparing prices for loads of all sizes across a range of carriers. This has never been possible, until now, making shipping more efficient and cheaper for the export of everything from cars to chemicals, pearls to plastic manufacturers.</p>



<p>

For UK exporters to thrive, booking a container needs to be as simple, efficient and cheap as booking a hotel or flight. </p>







<h4>Sources</h4>

<p>

<a href="http://atlas.media.mit.edu/en/profile/country/gbr/#Trade_Balance " target="_blank">http://atlas.media.mit.edu/en/profile/country/gbr/#Trade_Balance </a><br />



<a href="http://atlas.media.mit.edu/en/resources/about/ " target="_blank">http://atlas.media.mit.edu/en/resources/about/ </a><br />





<a href="http://www.theguardian.com/business/2016/jan/08/uk-trade-deficit-figure-prompts-alarm  " target="_blank">http://www.theguardian.com/business/2016/jan/08/uk-trade-deficit-figure-prompts-alarm </a><br />



<a href="http://www.theguardian.com/business/2015/jun/09/uk-trade-deficit-narrows-as-exports-rise " target="_blank">http://www.theguardian.com/business/2015/jun/09/uk-trade-deficit-narrows-as-exports-rise </a>

</p>









<a class="free-assessment" href="https://kontainers.com/freeshippingassessment" target="_blank"><img  style="border-radius: 8px; box-shadow: 0 8px 0 -0.5px #5b6b7c; margin-top: 28px;" src="https://kontainers.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/02/shipping-assessment-cta.jpg" alt="Free Shipping Assessment"  /></a>]]></content:encoded>

	</item>
	<item>
		<title>Celebrating World Health Day: Our Top 12 Food and Lifestyle Brands</title>
		<link>https://kontainers.com/celebrating-world-health-day-our-top-12-food-and-lifestyle-brands/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 04 Apr 2016 11:49:43 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[pete@kontainers.co.uk]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://kontainers.com/?p=1045</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<h3 class="mobile-sub-heading">Happy World Health Day!</h3>

<p><strong>Thanks to the internet and shipping, it's easier now more so than ever before to source rare and beneficial ingredients from around the world. From Nam Hom coconuts to Cordoba peanuts, consumers have access to the finest of ingredients and healthiest of options when it comes to food and lifestyle choices. While the online world helps connect us all, shipping makes it possible for us to be able to purchase and enjoy the many healthy food and lifestyle brands that are out there today. </strong></p>



<p>Since 1950, the World Health Organisation (WHO) has celebrated an annual health awareness day on 7 April, to draw attention to campaigns and issues that require global attention.</p>



<!--more-->

<p>The focus of World Health Day 2016 is diabetes. Prevention is usually the best form of cure, which is one issue the WHO is keen to raise this year. Eating right and working out to maintain a healthy body is the most efficient way to avoid diabetes. </p>



<p>As part of <a href="http://www.who.int/campaigns/world-health-day/2016/en/" target="_blank">World Health Day 2016</a>, we here at Kontainers have put together a list of twelve impressive healthy food, drink, dessert and fitness brands that have made it onto our favourite list.</p>



<p></p>



<h3>#1: Organic Burst:  The Superfood Powerhouse</h3>



<img src="https://kontainers.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/1-ORGANIC-BURST.jpg" alt="Organic Burst" width="1024" height="754" class="alignnone size-full wp-image-1058" />



<p><a href="https://www.organicburst.com/" target="_blank">Organic Burst</a> was founded in 2011, when Katya and Dimi, a husband and wife team, discovered the life-transforming benefits of pure, organic ancient foods. Since then, Organic Burst has evolved from a social enterprise into a movement, with loyal fans (#Bursters) in 105 countries.</p>



<p>We love the fact that Organic Burst has gone straight to the source; acquiring their ingredients directly from small producers with a process that gives back to local communities around the world.</p>





<p>Organic Burst offer several different varieties of superfoods including Spirulina, which contains a whopping 60-70% protein range! Other products like their Acai contains high levels of antioxidants which are good for your skin, heart, and also help you bounce back from tough workouts.</p>



<p>With benefits like those, which come from entirely natural and organic means, its no wonder why theyre known as superfoods!</p>



[bctt tweet="Acai contains high levels of antioxidants which are good for your skin and heart."]



<p></p>





<h3>#2: Nkd bars:  Delicious Bars That Have Nothing to Hide</h3>



<img src="https://kontainers.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/Nakd-bars.jpg" alt="Nkd bars" width="1024" height="754" class="alignnone size-full wp-image-1081" />



<p><a href="https://www.naturalbalancefoods.co.uk/nakd/" target="_blank">Nkd Bars</a> are unlike any others in the market and what sets them apart is the simplicity used in creating their wonderful treats. Unlike many other bars, you wont find a paragraph in fine print listing fillers and additives on their packaging. Take our favourite bar for example, the Cocoa Delight -  its made entirely out of dates, cashews, raisins, and with a hint of cocoa. THATS IT!<p>

 



<p>With no added sugars or syrups, Nkd Bars prove to be a great and delicious snack, (especially for diabetics looking to satisfy their sweet tooth). Containing only 100% natural ingredients, Nkd Bars are also wheat, dairy, and gluten free.</p>



<p></p>



<h3>#3: Aduna:  Making Baobab Famous</h3>



  <img src="https://kontainers.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/3-Aduna.jpg" alt="Aduna" width="1024" height="754" class="alignnone size-full wp-image-1065" />



<p><a href="http://aduna.com/" target="_blank">Aduna</a> is a healthy, natural food company with a social mission. The majority of Africas population - 70%, live in rural areas, with 90% dependent on small and micro-farming. Many of these people survive on just $1 a day.<p>

 

<p>Adunas mission is to create a sustainable standard of living for over 10 million in Africa, through the sale and promotion of super-ingredients, such as the Baobab.</p><p>Baobab contributes to a wide range of health and beauty benefits through its rich levels of vitamin C, fibre, and antioxidants. Sold as powders and energy bars, Adunas line of Baobab products are available online and in health stores around the world.</p>

  

[bctt tweet="Baobab supports energy release, immune function, and gives you healthy glowing skin! #MakeBaobabFamous"]







<p></p>



<h3>#4: Oppo:  Guilt-Free Ice Cream</h3>



<img src="https://kontainers.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/2-Oppo-Ice-Cream.jpg" alt="Oppo Ice Cream" width="1024" height="754" class="alignnone size-full wp-image-1063" />

  

<p>Sometimes, the thought of having to cut out our favourite dessert can be enough to put us off from wanting to make healthy choices, but whoever said we have to cut out anything? With a tagline like Ice Cream Just Got Guilt-Free, its no wonder why <a href="http://www.oppoicecream.co.uk/" target="_blank">Oppo</a> wins a spot on our list!</p>



<p>Substituting ingredients with healthier alternatives can make all the difference in the world and when it comes to Oppo, thats what they do great. Sugar in Oppo ice cream is replaced instead with stevia, a naturally sweet leaf from South America that contains zero calories and zero sugars. The result? A delicious dessert that seems like it's too good to be true. Even gym fanatics can indulge without guilt!</p>

 



[bctt tweet="One serving of Oppo ice cream has less sugar and calories than an apple!"]





<p></p>



<h3>#5: Manlife:  Go Nuts</h3>



  <img src="https://kontainers.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/Manilife.jpg" alt="Manlife" width="1024" height="754" class="alignnone size-full wp-image-1075" />



<p>Natural, healthy and delicious peanut butter. Instead of sourcing nuts from China or America, which require added sugars and sweeteners, <a href="http://mani-life.com/" target="_blank">Manlife</a> is made purely from Hi-oleic peanuts from Cordoba, Argentina.</p>



 

<p>Crunchier, and naturally sweeter, Cordoba peanuts are higher in calcium and antioxidants, and contain lower levels of acidity.</p>

 

<p>Unlike many other peanut butter brands, Manlife <a href="http://mani-life.com/why-we-dont-add-palm-oil/" target="_blank">don't add palm oil</a>, which is high in saturated fats, bad for the environment (wiping out the jungles of Borneo, Indonesia, and Malaysia - home to the rare Orangutan) and local economies.</p>





<p></p>



<h3>#6: Technogym:  The Wellness Company</h3>



<img src="https://kontainers.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/Technogym.jpg" alt="Technogym" width="1024" height="754" class="alignnone size-full wp-image-1076" />

  

<p><a href="http://www.technogym.com/gb/" target="_blank">Technogym</a> is a multi-national manufacturer of gym equipment. Maintaining an active lifestyle is one of the best ways to avoid the risk of diabetes, which is why the WHO is promoting fitness activities during 2016.</p>





<p>Technogyms line of equipment covers all the main elements of fitness, from cross trainers, to free weights, cables, and much more. We love the detailing and slick design of Technogym products, which sets them well above many other manufacturers in the market.</p>

 

<p>Whats more, Technogym goes beyond the production line by providing a variety of training resources and information in their commitment to make people across the world feel healthier and happier. They also invest in scientific medical research, having even published on the topic of <a href="http://www.technogym.com/gb/who-we-are/science-behind-our-work/" target="_blank">'Exercise for the management of type 2 diabetes.'</a></p>

  

  [bctt tweet="Maintaining an active lifestyle is one of the best ways to avoid the risk of #diabetes."]





<p></p>



<h3>#7: Pulsin:  Fuel Yourself</h3>



<img src="https://kontainers.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/Pulsin.jpg" alt="Pulsin" width="1024" height="754" class="alignnone size-full wp-image-1078" />

  

<p>Maintaining an active lifestyle is a major element in keeping fit and healthy, however having the right food to fuel your body before and after workouts can be just as important.</p>





<p><a href="http://www.pulsin.co.uk/" target="_blank">Pulsin</a> focus on exactly this through their delicious line of protein bars and raw chocolate brownies. Packed with all natural and healthy ingredients like maca and goji berries, Pulsin provide the perfect balance of nutrition and taste as your pre or post workout snack.</p>







<p></p>



<h3>#8: MightyBee:  Worlds Tastiest Coconut</h3>



  <img src="https://kontainers.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/MightyBee.jpg" alt="MightyBee" width="1024" height="754" class="alignnone size-full wp-image-1080" />



<p>A lot of what weve highlighted so far are snack foods or sweets. With <a href="http://www.mightybee.com/" target="_blank">MightyBee</a>, theyve taken the same approach to coconuts; with products ranging in coconut water, meat, and jerky which comes in flavours like Spicy BBQ, Teriyaki, and Chocolate Hazelnut.</p>





<p>The Nam Hom coconut grown and picked in Ratchaburi, Thailand, is known for a unique sweetness,' unlike anything the founders of MightyBee had ever tried before. You can buy their products online or through a wide range of retailers across the UK.</p>



[bctt tweet="The oil from coconuts contains high levels of lauric acid  known to help support weight loss."]

  

<p></p>



<h3>#9: Graze:  The Healthy Subscription</h3>



<img src="https://kontainers.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/Graze-Box.jpg" alt="Graze Box" width="1024" height="754" class="alignnone size-full wp-image-1077" />

  

<p>If youre not familiar with these guys already, boy have you been missing out! <a href="https://www.graze.com/uk/" target="_blank">Graze</a> is a subscription like no other, revolutionising the art of snacking.</p>





<p>Snacking, in fact, is an excellent way to keep your body fuelled throughout the day, maintain sugar levels, and help speed up your metabolism. The problem, however, is that too many of us resort to candy bars and crisps rather than healthier alternatives (which makes all the benefits mentioned above ineffectual).</p>





<p>Ranging from sweet to savoury, Graze has over 100 snack options to choose from in their catalogue. From vitamin packed super-berries, fibre rich flapjacks, and high protein edamame, the supply is endless in designing your perfect, personalised box.</p>





<p></p>



<h3>#10: Raw Bonbon:  Not Just For the Raw Food Aficionados</h3>



<img src="https://kontainers.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/Raw-Bonbon.jpg" alt="Raw Bonbon" width="1024" height="754" class="alignnone size-full wp-image-1079" />

  

<p>Having a sweet tooth and practising an active and healthy lifestyle meant that Iren Merdinyan was always stuck questioning the nutritional quality of the food she ate. Finding herself to be unsatisfied with the variety and flavour of many healthy sweets on the market, Irene began experimenting with raw cacao, raw cacao butter and nuts. Her experiments eventually created <a href="http://rawbonbon.com/" target="_blank">Raw Bonbon</a>  healthy yet delicious chocolate treats that can be enjoyed even by those who aren't aficionados of raw foods.</p>

  







<p>All of the ingredients are organic, with organic maple syrup or organic coconut sugar used instead of artificial sweeteners, as well as the use of  <a href="http://news.health.com/2015/03/27/what-is-matcha/" target="_blank">organic matcha,</a> (a particular favourite amongst the Kontainers team!). These delicious bonbons can be bought at independent organic shops, farmers markets and online through <a href="http://www.planetorganic.com/search/?name=raw%20bonbon" target="_blank">Planet Organic</a>.</p>



  [bctt tweet="Caffine rich Matcha helps boost metabolism and reduce blood pressure."]

 

  

  

<p></p>



<h3>#11: Alt Milk:  A Healthy Alternative to the Healthy Alternative</h3>



  <img src="https://kontainers.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/Alt-Milk.jpg" alt="Alt Milk" width="1024" height="754" class="alignnone size-full wp-image-1082" />	



<p>The UK has always been famous for its love of dairy products, but now with the changing times, consumers are becoming increasingly health-conscious, with many moving towards finding alternatives  especially for milk. This has sparked the rise of various soy and nut-based milk brands to come to market in recent years. Unfortunately, many of these brands use stabilizers, chemicals, and sugar to compensate for taste and extend shelf life.'</p>





<p>Sugar is, of course, something diabetics should be wary of, and consider natural alternatives.</p>



<p><a href="http://www.alt-milk.com/" target="_blank">Alt Milk</a> is different by using a luxurious 20% dairy-free blend, along with organic ingredients and a cold-pressed process that delivers great taste.</p>

 

<p>Alt Milk is 10x healthier than other non-dairy (nut-based) milk brands.</p>

  

  



<p></p>



<h3>#12: RHYTHM 108:  The Good-For-You Dessert Bar</h3>



  <img src="https://kontainers.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/4-RHYTHM-108.jpg" alt="RHYTHM 108" width="1024" height="754" class="alignnone size-full wp-image-1066" />



<p><a href="http://www.rhythm108.com/" target="_blank">Rhythm 108</a> promises healthy food thats delicious like dessert, and not tasting like bird food. Their products dont include any of the usual culprits found in snacks: corn-derivatives, isolates, dextrin, glycerin, sulphates, and all the others that the WHO - and other health organisations and doctors - blame for, amongst other things, diabetes.</p>





<p>The challenge we all face is making better dietary choices, which companies such as Rhythm 108 are making easier since its becoming clear that eating food thats bland soon leads to craving unhealthy food more than ever.</p>



<p>Rhythm 108 bars are 100% organic and made with all natural ingredients.</p>

  

<p></p>



<h3>Final Thoughts</h3>



<p>Maintaining an active lifestyle doesnt have to be a drag, just as any food with the word healthy attached in its bio doesnt have to taste like cardboard. The brands featured in our list break these very stigmas, and we love them for the amazing creations that theyve come up with. Thanks to shipping, we can get access to the best ingredients and materials from around the world, and thanks to the creative people behind the companies featured in our list, were in no short supply of wholesome and beneficial products!</p>

  

  



  





<div style="text-align:center; margin-top: 40px; border-top: 1px solid #ccc; padding: 30px 30px 0px 30px;">



<h3 style="font-style: italic; color: #888; font-size: 20px;"><span style="display:block; font-size:26px; padding-bottom: 10px;  color: #333;">Shipping?</span>Compare from real-time rates and book your order within minutes.</h3>



<a class="bc_button" href="https://kontainers.com/instantquotes" target="_blank" style="margin: 20px 0 40px 0; font-size: 22px; display: inline-block; float: none;">Get Instant Quotes</a>

  

</div>
